channel.title: Triggered phasor playing just one period?
channel.description: I'm looking for a phasor that would play on trigger just one period (one ramp then stay at 0 or stay at "maximum"). I haven't found such an object, so I'm looking for pointers on how to detect the "wrapping around" of the phasor. I'd like to detect when the addition of a phase-increment makes the phasor reach the "top" or when "the next phase-increment addition will wrap around and go back to zero-ish". Thanks for any pointer/suggestion of object to study!

item.title: Triggered phasor playing just one period?
item.dc:creator: @jfcharles Jean-Francois Charles
item.description:
@jfcharles wrote:

Not that easy, since K-Rate envelopes use int32_t type and when it goes "<0".
A S-rate phasor code is super efficient, just a repeated addition on a frac32.buffer.positive type. For this reason, we can't detect "<0", nor "==0" (==0 depends on the exact phase increment).
Still wondering how to "stop" or "suspend" such a phasor at the right time. Will keep working on it...
